A while back, at the entrance of a gym, there was a picture of a very thin and beautiful woman. The caption was "This summer, do you want to be a mermaid or a whale?" The story goes, a woman (of clothing size unknown) answered the following way: "Dear people, whales are always surrounded by friends (dolphins, seals, curious humans), they are sexually active and raise their children with great tenderness. They entertain like crazy with dolphins and eat lots of prawns. They swim all day and travel to fantastic places like Patagonia, the Barents Sea or the coral reefs of Polynesia. They sing incredibly well and sometimes even are on cds. They are impressive and dearly loved animals, which everyone defend and admires. Mermaids do not exist. But if they existed, they would line up to see a psychologist because of a problem of split personality: woman or fish? They would have no sex life and could not bear children. Yes, they would be lovely, but lonely and sad. And, who wants a girl that smells like fish by his side? Without a doubt, I'd rather be a whale. At a time when the media tells us that only thin is beautiful, I prefer to eat ice cream with my kids, to have dinner with my husband, to eat and drink and have fun with my friends. We women, we gain weight because we accumulate so much wisdom and knowledge that there isn't enough space in our heads, and it spreads all over our bodies. We are not fat, we are greatly cultivated. Every time I see my curves in the mirror, I tell myself: "How amazing am I ?! " (The girl on the picture is French model Tara Lynn)

Research in 2010 resulted in the following:
On every produced tank come 131 000 produced stuffed toys.
On every wall in the entire world come 200 000 welcome door-mats.
While a scientist develops a new weapon 1 million mothers bake a chocolate cake.
There are more funny videos on the internet than bad news in the world.
'Love' gets more hits than 'hate'.
There are many reasons to believe in a better world!!!

Anyway, I am reading Harry Potter and just had to think about how that little boy would compare to the world's most hated man. Here is the result:

Osama Bin Laden = 133.000.000 vs. Harry Potter = 383.000.000 hits.

Well then... Stupefy bin Laden!!!!

Originally posted by at Spirit Day
 


It’s been decided. On October 20th, 2010, we will wear purple in honor of the 6 gay boys who committed suicide in recent weeks/months due to homophobic abuse in their homes at at their schools. Purple represents Spirit on the LGBTQ flag and that’s exactly what we’d like all of you to have with you: spirit. Please know that times will get better and that you will meet people who will love you and respect you for who you are, no matter your sexuality. Please wear purple on October 20th. Tell your friends, family, co-workers, neighbors and schools.

RIP Tyler Clementi, Seth Walsh (top)
RIP Justin Aaberg, Raymond Chase (middle)
RIP Asher Brown and Billy Lucas. (bottom)

REBLOG to spread a message of love, unity and peace.

Ok, I promised a 'New Moon' review and since I just came home from the movie, again, I think I'll do that now. First I have to say that the german version (which I saw today) was not easy to listen to because I've met Annina Braunmiller und Johannes Raspe, who were the funniest people right after Mark and Craig at Ring*Con this year. They are the dubbing artists for Edward and Bella and I couldn't get Annina's face out of my head whenever Bella opened her mouth. ^^ I was really glad that I watched the movie in the OV first. What can I say? Bella still didn't show the right emotions in my opinion. She is somehow quite lifeless in my eyes. Edward got better and I like the scene in the forrest because you can almost touch his despair. But I have to get things in order. Birthday party: Loved, LOVE the scene in Carlisle's bureau with him and Bella. Book scene was better of course, but this was close to perfect! ♥ his calm, the way he talks to Bella, the way they burned the blood dripping gauzes. Geez, I had this moment (in the OV and today) that was notr very father-daughter-like between them because of the way Bella pushed her arm against his hip. What a sweet, sweet scene!
The Good-bye part: Like I said, Edward was almost perfect and Bella not so. I somehow wished they had put the original Sam-finds-Bella scene in the movie because how would she know who he is on the cliif later on? She never met him before he found her in the woods. Jacob: Hmmm, Jake... Iam not very keen about Jacob. I completely can't stand Taylor Lautner. But I liked the part about his garage and the bikes and the way he made Bella feel better, both in the movie and the book. Him making fun about Mike at the cinema? Priceless! And yes, I was really kind of drooling amazed about how much he changed. Which brings me to the wolves. Werwolves: OMG the wolves!!! First time seeing the black wolf, Sam, was a bit dissapointing, but then the others stepped out of the trees and I was like: WOW! And make that a double WOWooot for Jake standing up on the cliff, his fur being blown here and there by the wind. Beautiful! Sam and Emily's house was so cute and they got the part about the pack/family just right. ^^ Bella and Jake embracing in her room? ♥ Did somebody else wonder why Alice drove Carlisle's car? Pity she didn't talk about the car the way she had in the book. That part could have been longer, but they reached Volterra so soon. Volterra: Beautiful, sunny and royal. Which leads us to the Volturi. ♥ They remind me a lot of the decadent way Armand and Lestat used to live and love. The places, their clothes, their rules. Lestat once said: Evil is a point of view. God kills indiscriminately and so shall we. For no creatures under God are as we are, none so like him as ourselves. That could be the Volturi's Mantra, lol. Aro was my personal Lestat come to think of it! Jane! OMG, sweet little Dakota! Who knew that she could be that evil? Such a devil with the face of an angel. Perfect choice of actress!
That leaves Felix. ^^ Strong, beautiful, perfect! The fight scene between him and Edward was the best of the entire movie!
Anyone notice how HUGE his hand looked on Edward's neck? *lol* Scary! Daniel Cudmore a.k.a. Felix at Ring*Con this year!
The poll: Carlisle was ♥ again. He is the perfect father in my eyes and one of the most remarkable Vampires I've seen on TV or read about in books so far. Rosalie's explanation is only understandable if you know her story. That were the most important parts so far I could think of. The rest? Cheesy lines, even more now with the acting. Alice's vision was of Bella as a Vampire? ... *runs away screaming* Rosamunde Pilcher came to mind. Bella's visions of Edward? Brilliantly done. Charlie? First time I rerally adored him as a Dad. He was sort of lame in the books. At least at some parts. Emmett, my Emmett. Not what I expected. He is much more lovable in the books. He acts like a teenager on a sugar-high. *pulls face* Jasper... *gasps* Can't wait to see him in 'Eclipse'. Hope they get him right there, too, or even better. But his hair? *takes scissors and cuts off the too long curls* The contacts looked good on Esme and Carlisle, but they were too light for the rest of the family. Jane, Aro and the rest of the Volturi were really scary with the red eyes. It looked so real! Last, but not least: Jacob compared to Edward half naked? Well, go Jacob! Think about the muscles, the perfect shape of his body up in Bella's room when they embraced. He has one of the bodies I completely love! Slim waist, broad shoulders, muscles where-ever you look. OMG, his BACK! *drools again* *gulps* Did I say that out loud? TEAM CARLISLE! What else?

REAL VAMPIRES DON'T SPARKLE!!!

the End

A few days ago while I was writing I got stuck on one of the Boygroups I used to listen to in the past, Westlife. Understandably I was thinking about Boyzone, too, because it was them who introduced us to Westlife. They were special guests at a Boyzone concert, calling themselves still Eastside or something like it. Kieran and Nikki came walking through the waiting crowds giving autographs at another Boyzone concert. I remember that clearly, because I found Kieran's autograph when I sorted papers, collections and pictures yesterday. Anyway, I thought about listening to my old Boyzone CDs at well, but got stuck on Westlife. What a really sad coincidence that Stephen dies only 2 days later. This was and will always be one of my favorite songs of them. I just broke down in tears listening to it. Then I watched the news a few minutes ago and it made me so angry. They were of course talking about Stephen, spreading roumors like a disease about drugs, excessive alcohol abuse and kinky sex games. They don't know him at all, the way he was or lived and still they gossip as if they isn't more important things to life. For example how the people who really knew him feel right now. The rest of the boys arrived at the airport of Mallorca in the report and I can't get Mikey's stricken face with depressed tears out of my head. They all looked devastated. Westlife wrote a song on their new album, which fits all of it perfectly. You don't know Sorry for not using a cut.

Sore throat, runny nose, heavy cough. Just what I need 2 weeks before Ring*Con.

*sighs*

Why is it that, as a culture, we are more comfortable seeing two men holding guns than holding hands?" - Ernest Gaines. We would like to know who really believes in gay rights on livejournal. There is no bribe of a miracle or anything like that. If you truly believe in gay rights, then repost this and title the post as "Gay Rights". If you don't believe in gay rights, then just ignore this. Thanks. Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind.

I just checked my story journal and the last decent story, may it be in length or plot was in april. Since then I have written 2 drabbles with under 500words, plotless nonsense, mostly because I wanted to capture a feeling.

Because of my lack of writing and to get a fillip for thinking an entire story through and sit and finally write it down, I entered the <lj user="dave_uncensored"> Birthday challenge. *eeerm*

Well, it is due in the next 48hours, that's how nicely <lj user="bijouatweb"> described it, because of all the different time-zones all around the world.
It just drives my crazy! I didn't have an idea at all and when I finally got one (two days ago!) I really had to force myself to sit down and write.

Nightshift tonight, appointments tomorrow and the damn tiredness I can't seem to get rid off since my last nightshift.

1702 words full of crap so far... It's not dark enough, not enough emotions, not enough... everything. It just drives my crazy!

I need help, Tolkien related please. Does anybody know or know where I can look it up??? Did Boromir ever meet Gwaihir and the other eagles? Even more important for me to know is, did Tolkien ever tell which way he took to Rivendell? Did he take a boat along the river Anduin east of the misty mountains and crossed them through the High Pass? Or did he take the road to the Westfold, across Dunland and past Moria on the western side of the misty mountains, passing on his way the troll caves? I would really appreciate any help at all... ^_^

Why do people believe that elevators go just one direction? How would they get back up when they are at the lower level? *shakes head about ignorant people* I've been sending the very last parcel and cards today. I have bought almost all my X-Mas presents except for a few small things. Have I thanked everybody for their lovely Christmas cards yet? , , , , Tanja and today I got ' card. Thank you very much! I got my 'Casino Royale' theme/song today. *happy sigh* Anyone fancies going to see the movie on friday night with me? I have to see it again! Oh and I'd be very happy for a bunny. Or an army of bunnies all James related. Throw me a challenge I am kind of greedy for it, lol! Please?

It is quite pathetic how much I love this man. I am not speaking about Daniel Craig, I mean James. Not for real that is for sure but the more I see of him, the more I think about the story-line and what the man behind it means, the deeper and harder I am falling. I am not sure it will last but in the moment he's just one step away from Sean and that says a lot. I even dare to say he one step ahead of Viggo and that is nearly impossible at least in my small universe. I am desperate to write something but the idea has not yet taken shape. There are whispers of ideas, far pictures and always two men. Strong. Manly. Magical. A coast and an old house and the persisting little bugger of a dragon flying round in circles above their heads. He's trying to chase the Lost Boys' away and I am not sure I'll like that. And of course there's a song. A beautiful inspiring song with guitars and a rough voice. :) You know my name If you take a life do you know what you'll give? Odds are, you won't like what it is When the storm arrives, would you be seen with me? By the merciless eyes of deceit? I've seen angels fall from blinding heights But you yourself are nothing so divine Just next in line Arm yourself because no-one else here will save you The odds will betray you And I will replace you You can't deny the prize it may never fulfill you It longs to kill you Are you willing to die? The coldest blood runs through my veins You know my name If you come inside things will not be the same When you return to the night And if you think you've won You never saw me change The game that we all been playing I've seen diamonds cut through harder men Than you yourself But if you must pretend You may meet your end Arm yourself because no-one else here will save you The odds will betray you And I will replace you You can't deny the prize it may never fulfill you It longs to kill you Are you willing to die? The coldest blood runs through my veins Try to hide your hand Forget how to feel Forget how to feel Life is gone with just a spin of the wheel Spin of the wheel Arm yourself because no-one else here will save you The odds will betray you And I will replace you You can't deny the prize it may never fulfill you It longs to kill you Are you willing to die? The coldest blood runs through my veins You know my name

had the idea to make a CD for the RingCon weekend. I was thinking about that, too. For long rides on the train or the car. For the evenings and to lessen the RingCon Blues surely showing up on the way home and/or the days after. On the CD can go anything you'll like to listen to at the Con-weekend or that reminds you of last years Con. Songs that remind you of meetings with 'the Parkers', any 'Star' you've met or will meet or the gathering of friends you have fun with in one case or the other. and I thought that 5-8 songs for each will be ok. Depending on how many people would like to get a copy. And so it goes: You can send the songs you'll like to see on the CD to my EMail: Marius2045@yahoo.de or post them in your LJ via sendspace, myspace whatever and point me in the right direction. But choice No.1 would probably be easier. I'll burn the required CD's and send them to you. Speak I need your address! :) Meanwhile, you can think of an apropriate thank you for the shipping, lol. I am open for everything a story written esp. for me, a glass of the lovely strawberry wine at the hotel-bar, a picture of Mark/Craig you've shot... You get the idea! Good idea? Bad? Like to participate? Have a friend who would? Just point them in my direction. The thread with will x-posted here and there and stays unlocked. Hope a lot of people come to join us!

I watched 'Silent Hill' tonight. Sean was really misplaced, I can't believe it. Not because of him but of the movie. Not a good choice.
To make long things short: The movie was crap, absolutely shite man, as Ewan would say.
The music was good, though. And the picture of Sean in one of the last scenes. He wore Cargo-pants in olive and a plain white T-shirt and slept on the couch, his knees almost up to his chest. *sigh* that almost made it up for the lack of his OV voice. 
Had to see the movie in german, couldn't stand the thought of watching a Horror movie all by myself.

With the beard. And bare feet!!!! Methos! Matthew... He is sex on feet! Pure... ...sin! Angel Yes, I DO like him! Ewan of course The Daisy (he's on my list!?) Boone *sob* Mulder, still searching for the truth... Well, and the devil on bare feet! Last but not least, an angel... because she is just beautiful! Enough!

Cocaine Blues Early one mornin' while makin' the rounds I took a shot of cocaine and I shot my woman down I went right home and I went to bed I stuck that lovin' .44 beneath my head Got up next mornin' and I grabbed that gun Took a shot of cocaine and away I run Made a good run but I ran too slow They overtook me down in Juarez, Mexico Late in the hot joints takin' the pills In walked the sheriff from Jericho Hill He said Willy Lee your name is not Jack Brown You're the dirty heck that shot your woman down Said yes, oh yes my name is Willy Lee If you've got the warrant just a-read it to me Shot her down because she made me sore I thought I was her daddy but she had five more When I was arrested I was dressed in black They put me on a train and they took me back Had no friend for to go my bail They slapped my dried up carcass in that county jail Early next mornin' bout a half past nine I spied the sheriff coming down the line Ah, and he coughed as he cleared his throat He said come on you dirty heck into that district court Into the courtroom my trial began Where I was handled by twelve honest men Just before the jury started out I saw the little judge commence to look about In about five minutes in walked the man Holding the verdict in his right hand The verdict read murder in the first degree I hollered Lawdy Lawdy, have a mercy on me The judge he smiled as he picked up his pen 99 years in the Folsom pen 99 years underneath that ground I can't forget the day I shot that bad bitch down Come on you've gotta listen unto me Lay off that whiskey and let that cocaine be
Good Night! *zzz*
